Title: any_value(arg)
Description: Returns the first non-null value from arg. This function is affected by ordering.

Title: bit_xor(arg)
Description: Returns the bitwise XOR of all bits in a given expression.

Title: bitstring_agg(arg)
Description: Returns a bitstring whose length corresponds to the range of the non-null (integer) values, with bits set at the location of each (distinct) value.

Title: bool_and(arg)
Description: Returns true if every input value is true, otherwise false.

Title: bool_or(arg)
Description: Returns true if any input value is true, otherwise false.

Title: count(*)
Description: count()
Returns the number of rows in a group.

Title: count(arg)
Description: Returns the number of non-null values in arg.

Title: favg(arg)
Description: Calculates the average using a more accurate floating point summation (Kahan Sum).

Title: arbitrary(A)
Description: first(arg)
Returns the first value (null or non-null) from arg. This function is affected by ordering.

Title: kahan_sum
Description: sumKahan
fsum(arg)
Calculates the sum using a more accurate floating point summation (Kahan Sum).

Title: geometric_mean(A)
Description: geomean(arg)
Calculates the geometric mean of all non-null values in arg.

Title: first(A)
Description: arbitrary(arg)
Returns the first value (null or non-null) from arg. This function is affected by ordering.

Title: histogram(arg)
Description: Returns a MAP of key-value pairs representing buckets and counts.

Title: last(arg)
Description: Returns the last value of a column. This function is affected by ordering.

Title: array_agg
Description: list(arg)
Returns a LIST containing all the values of a column. This function is affected by ordering.

Title: max(arg)
Description: Returns the maximum value present in arg.

Title: max(arg, n)
Description: Returns a LIST containing the arg values for the "top" n rows ordered by arg descending.

Title: max_by(arg, val)
Description: Finds the row with the maximum val. Calculates the arg expression at that row. This function is affected by ordering.

Title: max_by(arg, val, n)
Description: Returns a LIST containing the arg expressions for the "top" n rows ordered by val descending.

Title: min(arg)
Description: Returns the minimum value present in arg.

Title: min(arg, n)
Description: Returns a LIST containing the arg values for the "bottom" n rows ordered by arg ascending.

Title: min_by(arg, val)
Description: Finds the row with the minimum val. Calculates the arg expression at that row. This function is affected by ordering.

Title: argMax(arg, val)
Description: arg_max(arg, val)
Finds the row with the maximum val. Calculates the arg expression at that row. This function is affected by ordering.

Title: min_by(arg, val, n)
Description: Returns a LIST containing the arg expressions for the "bottom" n rows ordered by val ascending.

Title: product(arg)
Description: Calculates the product of all non-null values in arg.

Title: listagg(arg, sep)
Description: group_concat(arg, sep)
string_agg(arg, sep)
Concatenates the column string values with a separator. This function is affected by ordering.

Title: sum(arg)
Description: Calculates the sum of all non-null values in arg.

Title: approx_count_distinct(x)
Description: Gives the approximate count of distinct elements using HyperLogLog.

Title: approx_quantile(x, pos)
Description: Gives the approximate quantile using T-Digest.

Title: reservoir_quantile(x, quantile, sample_size = 8192)
Description: Gives the approximate quantile using reservoir sampling, the sample size is optional and uses 8192 as a default size.

Title: corr(y, x)
Description: The correlation coefficient.
covar_pop(y, x) / (stddev_pop(x) * stddev_pop(y))

Title: covar_pop(y, x)
Description: The population covariance, which does not include bias correction.
(sum(x*y) - sum(x) * sum(y) / regr_count(y, x)) / regr_count(y, x), covar_samp(y, x) * (1 - 1 / regr_count(y, x))

Title: covar_samp(y, x)
Description: The sample covariance, which includes Bessel's bias correction.
(sum(x*y) - sum(x) * sum(y) / regr_count(y, x)) / (regr_count(y, x) - 1), covar_pop(y, x) / (1 - 1 / regr_count(y, x))

Title: argMax(arg, val, n)
Description: arg_max(arg, val, n)
Returns a LIST containing the arg expressions for the "top" n rows ordered by val descending.

Title: entropy(x)
Description: The log-2 entropy.

Title: kurtosis_pop(x)
Description: The excess kurtosis (Fisher’s definition) without bias correction.

Title: kurtosis(x)
Description: The excess kurtosis (Fisher's definition) with bias correction according to the sample size.

Title: mad(x)
Description: The median absolute deviation. Temporal types return a positive INTERVAL.
median(abs(x - median(x)))

Title: median(x)
Description: The middle value of the set. For even value counts, quantitative values are averaged and ordinal values return the lower value.
quantile_cont(x, 0.5)

Title: mode(x)
Description: The most frequent value.

Title: quantile_cont(x, pos)
Description: The interpolated pos-quantile of x for 0 <= pos <= 1, i.e., orders the values of x and returns the pos * (n_nonnull_values - 1)th (zero-indexed) element (or an interpolation between the adjacent elements if the index is not an integer). If pos is a LIST of FLOATs, then the result is a LIST of the corresponding interpolated quantiles.

Title: quantile
Description: quantile_disc(x, pos)

The discrete pos-quantile of x for 0 <= pos <= 1, i.e., orders the values of x and returns the greatest(ceil(pos * n_nonnull_values) - 1, 0)th (zero-indexed) element. If pos is a LIST of FLOATs, then the result is a LIST of the corresponding discrete quantiles.

Title: regr_avgx(y, x)
Description: The average of the independent variable for non-NULL pairs, where x is the independent variable and y is the dependent variable.

Title: regr_avgy(y, x)
Description: The average of the dependent variable for non-NULL pairs, where x is the independent variable and y is the dependent variable.

Title: argMin(arg, val)
Description: arg_min(arg, val)
Finds the row with the minimum val. Calculates the arg expression at that row. This function is affected by ordering.

Title: regr_count(y, x)
Description: The number of non-NULL pairs.

Title: regr_intercept(y, x)
Description: The intercept of the univariate linear regression line, where x is the independent variable and y is the dependent variable.
regr_avgy(y, x) - regr_slope(y, x) * regr_avgx(y, x)

Title: regr_r2(y, x)
Description: The squared Pearson correlation coefficient between y and x. Also: The coefficient of determination in a linear regression, where x is the independent variable and y is the dependent variable.

Title: regr_slope(y, x)
Description: The slope of the linear regression line, where x is the independent variable and y is the dependent variable.
Returns the slope of the linear regression line, where x is the independent variable and y is the dependent variable.
regr_sxy(y, x) / regr_sxx(y, x)

Title: regr_sxx(y, x)
Description: The sample variance, which includes Bessel's bias correction, of the independent variable for non-NULL pairs, where x is the independent variable and y is the dependent variable.

Title: regr_sxy(y, x)
Description: The sample covariance, which includes Bessel's bias correction.

Title: regr_syy(y, x)
Description: The sample variance, which includes Bessel's bias correction, of the dependent variable for non-NULL pairs , where x is the independent variable and y is the dependent variable.
The sample variance, which includes Bessel's bias correction, of the dependent variable for non-NULL pairs, where x is the independent variable and y is the dependent variable.

Title: skewness(x)
Description: The skewness.

Title: stddev_pop(x)
Description: The population standard deviation.
sqrt(var_pop(x))

Title: stddev(x)
Description: stddev_samp(x)
The sample standard deviation.
sqrt(var_samp(x))

Title: argMin(arg, val, n)
Description: arg_min(arg, val, n)
Returns a LIST containing the arg expressions for the "bottom" n rows ordered by val ascending.

Title: var_pop(x)
Description: The population variance, which does not include bias correction.
(sum(x^2) - sum(x)^2 / count(x)) / count(x), var_samp(y, x) * (1 - 1 / count(x))

Title: variance(arg, val)
Description: var_samp(x)
The sample variance, which includes Bessel's bias correction.
(sum(x^2) - sum(x)^2 / count(x)) / (count(x) - 1), var_pop(y, x) / (1 - 1 / count(x))

Title: grouping()
Description: For queries with GROUP BY and either ROLLUP or GROUPING SETS: Returns an integer identifying which of the argument expressions where used to group on to create the current supper-aggregate row.

Title: first(A)
Description: arbitrary(arg)
Returns the first value (null or non-null) from arg. This function is affected by ordering.

Title: argMax(arg, val)
Description: arg_max(arg, val)
Finds the row with the maximum val. Calculates the arg expression at that row. This function is affected by ordering.

Title: argMax(arg, val, n)
Description: arg_max(arg, val, n)
Returns a LIST containing the arg expressions for the "top" n rows ordered by val descending.

Title: argMin(arg, val)
Description: arg_min(arg, val)
Finds the row with the minimum val. Calculates the arg expression at that row. This function is affected by ordering.

Title: argMin(arg, val, n)
Description: arg_min(arg, val, n)
Returns a LIST containing the arg expressions for the "bottom" n rows ordered by val ascending.

Title: list
Description: array_agg(arg)
Returns a LIST containing all the values of a column. This function is affected by ordering.

Title: mean
Description: avg(arg)
Calculates the average of all non-null values in arg.

Title: list
Description: array_agg(arg)
Returns a LIST containing all the values of a column. This function is affected by ordering.

Title: count(*)
Description: count()
Returns the number of rows in a group.

Description: first(arg)
Returns the first value (null or non-null) from arg. This function is affected by ordering.

Description: sumKahan
fsum(arg)
Calculates the sum using a more accurate floating point summation (Kahan Sum).

Title: kahan_sum
Description: sumKahan
fsum(arg)
Calculates the sum using a more accurate floating point summation (Kahan Sum).

Title: geometric_mean(A)
Description: geomean(arg)
Calculates the geometric mean of all non-null values in arg.

Title: array_agg
Description: list(arg)
Returns a LIST containing all the values of a column. This function is affected by ordering.

Title: listagg(arg, sep)
Description: group_concat(arg, sep)
string_agg(arg, sep)
Concatenates the column string values with a separator. This function is affected by ordering.

Title: listagg(arg, sep)
Description: group_concat(arg, sep)
string_agg(arg, sep)
Concatenates the column string values with a separator. This function is affected by ordering.

Title: quantile
Description: quantile_disc(x, pos)

The discrete pos-quantile of x for 0 <= pos <= 1, i.e., orders the values of x and returns the greatest(ceil(pos * n_nonnull_values) - 1, 0)th (zero-indexed) element. If pos is a LIST of FLOATs, then the result is a LIST of the corresponding discrete quantiles.

Title: stddev(x)
Description: stddev_samp(x)
The sample standard deviation.
sqrt(var_samp(x))

Title: mean
Description: avg(arg)
Calculates the average of all non-null values in arg.

Title: variance(arg, val)
Description: var_samp(x)
The sample variance, which includes Bessel's bias correction.
(sum(x^2) - sum(x)^2 / count(x)) / (count(x) - 1), var_pop(y, x) / (1 - 1 / count(x))

Title: bit_and(arg)
Description: Returns the bitwise AND of all bits in a given expression.

Title: bit_or(arg)
Description: Returns the bitwise OR of all bits in a given expression.
